page.title: 19South Leics.Heraldry
page.content: Mrs.Wray was Mayor of S.Wigston and she keeps a shop on the Blaby Rd.When she was Mayor she went to a Garden Party at Buckingham Palace.She told us about the Coat of Arms of S.Wigston. The railway line has always been very important here and the first houses were built in Station St.There was a level crossing where the park is now. The prosperity brought by the railway line is shown by two pairs of narrow horizontal stripes in gold on the badge.There are tigers on the badge representing the Leicestershire Regt. which used to be at Glen Parva Barracks.The owl at the top of the badge represents wisdom,it also stands for Oadby,Wigston,Leicester. Mrs.Wray has lived in S.Wigston since 1921,and her shop has been there for 64 yrs.{(By Parklands School children)
